articles.title: About me.
articles.contents:
I am currently pursuing my Master’s in Environmental Science & Management from the Bren School for the Environment at the University of California - Santa Barbara. Here, I strive to combine data science and journalism to help marginalized groups have the information they need to create a more just world.
Prior to this, I lived in the Midwest for the past 9-years. I graduated from Macalester College in 2016 with a B.A. in Geology. It was there I conducted research on anisotropy of magnetic susceptibility in channelized lava flows in Iceland. At the time I was fortunate enough to work on the Syracuse Lava Project to create analog flows in juxtaposition to the channelized flow at my field site.

            Bio
            I am a master’s student studying environmental science and management at the Bren School at the University of California - Santa Barbara. I specialize in water resource management and am passionate about helping create self-sufficient, resilient communities that transcend hierarchical structures to create a more just future for all. In addition, I am fascinated by noise and love to create ambient music.
            
            
            Education
            Master’s of Environmental Science & Management - UC Santa Barbara (Expected 2023)Bachelor of Arts in Geology - Macalester College 2016
